subject: RE: [junit] How to log JUnits Tests
msgSnippet: If you truly mean logging, then you could take the easy route we took. We made a subclass of JUnit s TestCase class which prints out the name of the test when
messageBody:
If you truly mean logging, then you could take the easy route we took.
We made a subclass of JUnit's TestCase class which prints out the name
of the test when each test method starts and finishes, using Log4j
(which is the coolest Java tool around).


Todd.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of didoss@...
> Sent: Thursday, September 07, 2006 8:08 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] How to log JUnits Tests
>
> What do you mean by logging,...do you mean reports of your
> results - then Google JUnitReport.
>
> -------------- Original message --------------
> From: "isowitz" <isowitz@...>
> I have a problem with logging JUnit tests. In a package I
> have a AllTests class that calls several tests. The result of
> that tests should be logged.
> I'm not familiar with JUnit or logging so I try to find
> examples in the web. Unfortunately i found no examples or
> hints for me.
>
> How do you log your JUnit results?
>
>
>
>
